comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Sorry to contradict, but the HMS 'Nelson' in the main photo is this 1876 ship - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Nelson_(1876). On the Australian Station between 1881 and 1889, which might help date the photo. The coal hulk pic is of HMVS 'Nelson' (1814 !!). Confused? So am I.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: HMS 'Undine' (1881) (see note) has acquired a Wikipedia entry since I last looked, with this - "Commenced service on the Australia Station from September 1883 and carried out patrol work and worked as a tender to the flagship HMS Nelson.[1] She was sold in Sydney in April 1888 and was renamed Ruby by her new owners." - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Undine_(1881) So date 1883 - April 1888 so far. Betting on 1887 (Golden Jubilee) or January 1888 (Centenary).

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thoroughly confused - but now the fog has lifted, so its clear sailing ... until my next shipwreck!
